official_title: Open Label Phase 1 and Target Validation Study of ONC206 in Children and Young Adults With Newly Diagnosed or Recurrent Diffuse Midline Glioma (DMG), and Other Recurrent Primary Malignant Central Nervous System (CNS) Tumors
brief_title: ONC206 for Treatment of Newly Diagnosed, Recurrent Diffuse Midline Gliomas, and Other Recurrent Malignant CNS Tumors
cancer_type_display: A study for children and young adults with newly diagnosed or recurrent diffuse midline gliomas (DMG) and other recurrent malignant central nervous system (CNS) tumors like glioblastoma and ependymoma.
cancer_tags: Recurrent Malignant Central Nervous System Neoplasm
World Health Organization (WHO) Grade III Glioma
prior_treatments_excluded: Current treatment with other investigational drugs
Current treatment with other anti-cancer agents
Strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4, 2D6, 1A2, 2C9 and 2C19
Prior ONC201 in the upfront setting (for specific arms)

locations.facility: The University Children's Hospital in Zurich

key_inclusion_summary: Diagnosis of newly diagnosed or recurrent H3K27-altered diffuse midline glioma (DMG), or other recurrent primary malignant CNS tumors.
Age between 2 and 21 years for dose escalation cohorts.
Karnofsky performance status >= 50 (for age > 16) or Lansky >= 50 (for age <= 16).
Adequate bone marrow and organ function.
Willingness to provide adequate tumor tissue sample.
key_exclusion_summary: Currently receiving other investigational drugs or anti-cancer agents.
Known immunodeficiency disorders like HIV or Hepatitis B/C, or autoimmune disorders requiring systemic immunosuppressive therapy.
Female participants who are pregnant or breastfeeding.
Use of strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4, 2D6, 1A2, 2C9 and 2C19 enzymes within 14 days of starting the study drug.
